title: 115_s3555
content: The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" is the short title of this legislation, which includes definitions for various terms. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" includes definitions for terms such as 'LGBT' and 'older LGBT individual'. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" includes the establishment of the Office of Older LGBT Policy. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration, headed by a Director appointed by the Secretary to coordinate activities for improved services for older individuals. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration, headed by a Director appointed by the Secretary to coordinate activities for improved services for older individuals. The Director will coordinate activities within the Department of Health and Human Services and advocate for older LGBT individuals at the federal and state levels. The Office of Older LGBT Policy coordinates activities for improved services for older individuals, advocates at federal and state levels, conducts research on LGBT aging, and collects information on challenges faced by older LGBT individuals. The Office of Older LGBT Policy focuses on gathering statistics and disseminating information on challenges faced by older LGBT individuals, especially those in rural areas and living with HIV/AIDS. They recommend policies and promote culturally competent care for this demographic. The Office of Older LGBT Policy focuses on recommending policies and priorities beneficial to older LGBT individuals, promoting culturally competent care and services for them, and administering grants to help this demographic. The Director is required to submit a report to Congress every five years detailing the activities carried out under this subsection. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include a Rural Outreach Grant Program under Part A of title IV. The section defines the terms 'Director' and 'eligible entity' for the Office of Older LGBT Policy. An eligible entity can be a State or an organization focusing on serving older or LGBT individuals. The purpose of this section is to provide resources and incentives for eligible entities to create a long-term strategy for connecting with older LGBT individuals, including agencies, organizations, and institutions serving their needs. A rural area is defined as an area not designated as urban by the Census Bureau. The purpose of this section is to provide resources and incentives for eligible entities to create a long-term strategy for connecting with older LGBT individuals in rural areas through grants approved by the Director. An eligible entity seeking a grant under this section must submit an application to the Director with a description of proposed activities and characteristics. An application for a grant under this section must include a description of proposed activities, the population in a rural area served, resources available, and intent to partner with local organizations. The application for a grant must include a description of proposed activities, population served, available resources, intent to partner with local organizations, evidence of meeting urgent needs, and any other necessary information determined by the Director. The grant application must include proposed activities, population served, available resources, intent to partner with local organizations, evidence of meeting urgent needs, and other necessary information determined by the Director to achieve the purpose described in subsection (b). Approved activities for the grant may involve creating a partnership between older LGBT individuals in rural areas and the eligible entity receiving the grant. Approved activities for the grant may include education and training for outreach to older LGBT individuals in rural areas, reducing isolation, improving access to care, and fostering relationships within the local LGBT community. The grant aims to support older LGBT individuals in rural areas by building relationships with the local community, fostering connections with LGBT-affirming service providers, improving cultural competency, and expanding non-discrimination policies. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant to support older LGBT individuals in rural areas, including expanding non-discrimination policies to protect sexual orientation and gender identity. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant, allowing eligible entities to adapt them as needed. Entities must cooperate with relevant state and local agencies in carrying out the activities. An eligible entity receiving a grant under this section must cooperate and coordinate with state and local agencies and other organizations providing services for older LGBT individuals in the area. An eligible entity receiving a grant under this section must prioritize cooperating and coordinating with public and private organizations serving economically underserved populations. The Director is required to submit reports to Congress on the activities carried out under this section. The Director must submit reports to Congress on activities conducted under this section every second fiscal year starting in 2020.
